intro: Ranunculus auricomus subsp. glabratus, commonly known as the smoothleaf buttercup, is a member of the Ranunculaceae family. It is characterized by its bright yellow, cup-shaped flowers and smooth, glabrous leaves. Native to the western United States, this species thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and streambanks. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with simple, alternate leaves that are usually heart-shaped. It blooms from late spring to early summer, producing showy flowers that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies.
